      • findAllItems

        public static final <T> java.util.List<T> findAllItems(java.util.List<T> list,
                                                       java.lang.Object... keyValue)
        Given a list of objects (database beans) scan the list for matches in the keyValue pairs. Returning a new sublist of only the matches. Between pairs an "AND" operation is performed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the POJO database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        list - the list of beans to be scanned (filtered).
        keyValue - the VarArgs key value pairs, the key is the beans property name
        Returns:
        the sublist if beans which match the key value pair filter.

        public static final <T> T findOneItem(java.util.List<T> list,
                                      java.lang.String key,
                                      java.lang.Object value)
        Given a list of objects (database beans) scan the list for matches in the keyValue pairs. Returning a new sublist of only the matches.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        list - the list of beans to be scanned (filtered).
        key - the name of the property which is to be filtered.
        value - the value of the property for a match
        Returns:
        the sublist if beans which match the key value pair filter.

      • findClassBySimpleName

        public static final java.lang.Class<?> findClassBySimpleName(java.lang.String classname,
                                                             java.util.List<java.lang.String> searchPackages)
        Returns first loaded Class found in the searchPackages
        Parameters:
        classname - the simple class name (e.g. "String")
        searchPackages - String[] of packages to search.
      • Place the more important packages at the top since the first Class found is returned
        • //Example public static final String[] searchPackages = { "java.lang", "java.util", "my.company", "my.company.other" };
        Returns:
        the loaded Class or null if not found

        public static final java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getClassesWithAnnotation(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                                                java.lang.Class annotationClass)
        Given the class loader, the package name and the database name find all table classes for this database.
        Parameters:
        packageName - - package name where database classes can be scanned for.
        annotationClass - - the name of the database in which to scan for classes containing Table annotations, if null return all classes which map to a table, for all databases.
        Returns:
        the list of all classes in the package.

      • toTableClass

        public static final java.lang.Class<?> toTableClass(java.lang.String packagename,
                                                    java.lang.String tablename)
        Given the table name, return the bean, which is a java model of the table.
        Parameters:
        packagename - the name of the database, underlying database can be schema, catalog or filename based on implementation.
        databasename - the name of the database, underlying database can be schema, catalog or filename based on implementation.
        tablename - the name of the table, for java model is desired.
        Returns:
        the java class which contains annotations which model the table, null if not defined.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        tableClass - java table model, with annotations.
        Returns:

      • callTableValidation

        public static <T> java.util.List<com.viper.database.model.Param> callTableValidation(T bean)
                                                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Call the bean validation class, and all the column validation classes. Table validation is for overall validation, column validation for each column. There is a custom validation possible per column and a predefined validation per column. String will be validated for length, and possible pattaern match. Numbers can be validated against a range, etc.
        Parameters:
        bean - the bean which is to be validated On return a list of errors will be returned, these errors should be looked up in a locale properties file for translation, even for english.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • callTableValidation

                                                                              throws java.lang.Exception

      • get

        public static <E> E get(java.lang.Object bean,
                        java.lang.String fieldname)
        Given the bean object and the field name, retrieve the value of the fieldname. Look at the super classes. Ignoring the java and javax classes.
        Parameters:
        bean - the java bean object (pojo).
        fieldname - the name of the field to retrieve value of.
        Returns:
        the value of the field in the bean at the fieldname, null value is actually null value of the field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the fieldname not found.
